date-difference.title: Date Difference Calculator
date-difference.description: Calculate the exact time duration between two different dates, including business days.
date-difference.howItWorks: This tool calculates the time difference between two dates by subtracting the first date from the second. It displays results in years, months, and days, along with total days and business days (excluding weekends).
useCases: Calculate employment duration for retirement or severance
Find out time remaining until an important event or deadline
Calculate pregnancy and due dates
Determine contract and agreement durations
Calculate vacation and absence days
seoTips: Make sure to enter the earlier date in the start field
Enable the include end date option if you want it counted
Use business days result for professional calculations
commonMistakes: Reversing the date order (putting end before start)
Forgetting that business days exclude Saturday and Sunday only
Not accounting for varying month lengths

faqs.question: How are business days calculated?
faqs.answer: Business days are calculated by subtracting weekend days (Saturday and Sunday) from total days. The calculations do not include public holidays as they vary by country.

faqs.question: Can I calculate the difference between past dates?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can calculate the difference between any two dates whether in the past or future, as long as you enter the earlier date in the start field.

faqs.question: Why does the result differ from my manual calculation?
faqs.answer: The calculator accounts for varying month lengths (28-31 days) and leap years, which may give different results than approximate manual calculations.

date-difference.start_date_tooltip: Enter the starting date of the period
date-difference.end_date_tooltip: Enter the ending date of the period
date-difference.note_text: Business days exclude weekends. Calculation accounts for varying month lengths and leap years.
date-difference.error_start_after_end: Start date must be before end date

date-format-converter.title: Date Format Converter
date-format-converter.description: Convert dates between various global and local formats.
date-format-converter.howItWorks: The converter takes the input date and reformats it in various ways such as ISO 8601, US format, European format, Unix timestamp, and more, making it easy to use dates in different contexts.
useCases: Convert dates for use in programming and databases
Standardize date formats in official documents
Convert dates between US and European formats
Get Unix timestamps for technical applications
Format dates for reports and presentations
seoTips: Use ISO 8601 format for international compatibility
Understand the difference between DD/MM and MM/DD
Use Unix timestamps for precision in programming
commonMistakes: Confusing US format (month/day) with European format (day/month)
Forgetting that Unix timestamp starts from January 1, 1970
Not accounting for timezone in conversions

faqs.question: What is ISO 8601 format?
faqs.answer: It is the international standard for writing dates as YYYY-MM-DD (year-month-day), and is the recommended format for international and programming use.

faqs.question: What is the difference between US and European formats?
faqs.answer: US format writes the month first (MM/DD/YYYY), while European writes the day first (DD/MM/YYYY). For example: 03/05/2024 means March 5 in the US and May 3 in Europe.

faqs.question: What is a Unix timestamp?
faqs.answer: It is the number of seconds elapsed since January 1, 1970 at 00:00:00 UTC. It is widely used in programming for storing dates.

unix-timestamp-converter.title: Unix Timestamp Converter
unix-timestamp-converter.description: Convert between Unix timestamps and human-readable dates.
unix-timestamp-converter.howItWorks: This converter transforms between Unix timestamps (seconds since January 1, 1970) and human-readable dates. You can convert in both directions: from timestamp to date or vice versa.
useCases: Convert database timestamps to readable dates
Generate timestamps for use in programming
Analyze server and system logs
Debug applications that use Unix timestamps
Convert dates for API calls
seoTips: Remember that timestamps are in seconds, not milliseconds
Use the current timestamp as a reference for verification
Pay attention to timezone when converting
commonMistakes: Confusing timestamps in seconds with milliseconds
Forgetting that timestamps are based on UTC
Entering negative timestamps without knowing they represent dates before 1970

faqs.question: Why does the timestamp start from 1970?
faqs.answer: Unix developers chose this date (January 1, 1970) as the starting point because it was close to the system's development time and easy to calculate.

faqs.question: What is the difference between seconds and milliseconds?
faqs.answer: Timestamps in seconds typically have 10 digits, while milliseconds have 13 digits. Milliseconds = seconds x 1000.

faqs.question: Can dates before 1970 be represented?
faqs.answer: Yes, using negative numbers. For example: -86400 represents December 31, 1969.

day-of-week-calculator.title: Day of Week Calculator
day-of-week-calculator.description: Find out what day of the week any date falls on in the past or future.
day-of-week-calculator.howItWorks: The calculator uses mathematical algorithms to determine the day of the week for any date. It accounts for leap years and Gregorian calendar rules to provide accurate results.
useCases: Find out what day your birthday or any historical event fell on
Plan events on specific dates
Check the day of the week for a future appointment
Historical research to find days of past events
Schedule meetings and appointments
seoTips: Enter the date in the correct format for accurate results
Use the calculator to verify dates of holidays and occasions
Check the week number for planning purposes
commonMistakes: Entering dates in the wrong format
Confusing Gregorian with other calendar systems
Forgetting that weeks may start on Sunday or Monday depending on culture

faqs.question: How does the calculator determine the day of the week?
faqs.answer: The calculator uses Zeller's algorithm or similar methods to mathematically compute the day of the week based on the day, month, and year.

faqs.question: Can I find the day for very old dates?
faqs.answer: Yes, but note that the current Gregorian calendar started in 1582, and dates before that followed the Julian calendar.

faqs.question: What is the week number of the year?
faqs.answer: It is the ordinal number of the week in the year from 1 to 52 or 53, commonly used in business and planning.

date_difference.title: Date Difference Calculator
date_difference.description: Calculate the exact time duration between two different dates.

howItWorks.title: How the Date Difference Calculator Works
howItWorks.formula: Difference = End Date - Start Date (accounting for varying month lengths and leap years)
howItWorks.explanation: This calculator computes the precise time difference between any two dates. It accounts for the varying lengths of months (28-31 days), leap years, and can calculate business days by excluding weekends. The algorithm processes complete years first, then remaining months, and finally days.

steps.name: Enter Start Date
steps.text: Input the beginning date of the period you want to measure

steps.name: Enter End Date
steps.text: Input the ending date of the period

steps.name: Optional: Include End Date
steps.text: Choose whether to count the end date itself in the calculation

steps.name: View Results
steps.text: See the difference in years, months, days, plus total days and business days

useCases.title: Employment Duration Calculation
useCases.description: Calculate exact length of service for retirement benefits, severance pay, or job applications

useCases.title: Project Timeline Planning
useCases.description: Determine the number of working days available for project completion

useCases.title: Pregnancy and Due Date Tracking
useCases.description: Calculate weeks of pregnancy or days until expected delivery

useCases.title: Contract and Lease Management
useCases.description: Verify exact duration of agreements for legal and financial purposes

useCases.title: Event Countdown
useCases.description: Find out exactly how many days until an important event or deadline

seoTips: Always enter the earlier date in the start field for positive results
Enable 'Include end date' when both dates should be counted (e.g., for hotel stays)
Business days calculation excludes Saturdays and Sundays only, not public holidays
Use total days for simple duration; use years/months/days for human-readable format
For legal documents, verify whether the end date should be inclusive or exclusive
commonMistakes: Entering the end date before the start date, which produces negative or error results
Forgetting that business days exclude weekends but not public holidays
Not considering that months have different lengths (28-31 days)
Assuming February always has 28 days (29 in leap years)
Confusing 'duration' with 'count' - a stay from Jan 1-3 is 2 nights but 3 days inclusive

faqs.question: How are business days calculated?
faqs.answer: Business days count only weekdays (Monday through Friday), excluding Saturdays and Sundays. Public holidays are not excluded as they vary by country and region. For accurate business day counts including holidays, you may need to adjust manually.

faqs.question: Why does my calculation differ from counting on a calendar?
faqs.answer: The calculator accounts for varying month lengths and leap years precisely. Manual counting often uses approximations (30 days per month) which can be off by several days over longer periods.

faqs.question: Should I include the end date in my calculation?
faqs.answer: It depends on your purpose. For hotel stays or event duration, include it. For calculating someone's age or time elapsed, typically exclude it. The calculator gives you both options.

faqs.question: Can I calculate the difference between dates in different years?
faqs.answer: Yes, the calculator handles any date range across different years, correctly accounting for leap years and the varying number of days in each month throughout the period.

faqs.question: What is the maximum date range I can calculate?
faqs.answer: The calculator can handle dates spanning many centuries. However, for extremely long periods, results in years/months/days are more meaningful than total days or hours.

date_difference.info_description: Calculates exact time between dates including business days.
date_difference.error_start_after_end: Start date must be before end date
